availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John McGuire (Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Ruth Walker in Carter County on October 27, 1854. Father of Emily McGuire, James McGuire, Stephen McGuire, William McGuire, Thomas McGuire, Mary McGuire, Rachel McGuire, and Alice McGuire. Farmer in Carter County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Served in 40th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from September 25, 1863 to March 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 242B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Grayson, p. 262.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carter County Marriages, Film #001759301, p. 144.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0433.
